data.question: What is the composition of the microporous manganese formate synthesized?
What method was used to synthesize the porous manganese(II) formate?
data.answer: Heating a mixture of manganese(II) chloride and formic acid dissolved in diethylformamide (DEF)/1,4-dioxane in a sealed tube for 2 days.

data.question: What gases does the microporous manganese formate selectively adsorb?
Why does the microporous manganese formate not adsorb N2 and other gases with larger kinetic diameters?
data.answer: Due to the small aperture of the channels in the material.

data.question: Is the framework of the microporous manganese formate stable after guest removal?
data.answer: Yes, the framework is stable enough to maintain single-crystallinity after the complete guest removal at 150 °C under a reduced pressure.
